definition: of an organic compound, a mixture of two partially miscible liquids A and B produces two conjugate solutions: one of A in B and another of B in A, to unite chemically so that the product is easily broken down into the original compounds
details:
adjective
- of an organic compound
= synonyms: conjugated
- formed by the union of two compounds
= example: formed by the union of two compounds
= synonyms: conjugated
- (of a pinnate leaflet) having only one pair of leaflets
- joined together especially in a pair or pairs
= synonyms: coupled
noun
- a mixture of two partially miscible liquids A and B produces two conjugate solutions: one of A in B and another of B in A
= synonyms: conjugate solution
verb
- to unite chemically so that the product is easily broken down into the original compounds
- to undergo conjugation
- to add inflections showing person, number, gender, tense, aspect, etc.
= example: to add inflections showing person, number, gender, tense, aspect, etc.
